meanings.definition: To be the leader or director of
meanings.sent1: She helmed the school project with confidence.
meanings.sent2: The captain helmed the ship through the storm.
meanings.sent3: He helmed the family game night, making sure everyone had fun.
meanings.sent4: The CEO helmed the company to great success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher helmed the class discussion, guiding students' learning.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect with a helmet
meanings.sent1: The knight helmed himself before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The cyclist helmed up before riding on the busy road.
meanings.sent3: She helmed her head with a helmet to stay safe while biking.
meanings.sent4: The construction worker helmed his head to prevent injuries.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter helmed up before entering the burning building.
